reviews.text:
Beautiful location and its housed in a historic building. Located close to Cubbon Park, it is easy to access by road, Metro or public transport. 

 It has good collection of Kannada books. Not much to offer for medical students and general knowledge books are outdated. 
Overall a good place for students and researchers. It is neatly arranged and quiet.

A state of the art library. Books ordered genre wise. Ample reading places. A entire different section for News papers and magazines. Bag holding facility is available. Toilet amenities are also there. Digital library is also established.

It’s a knowledge hub. peaceful atmosphere located inside the Cubbon Park.  Perfectly secluded in between the greenary, historic one with great architecture. You'll find thousands of books! Very nearly maintained, clean. Easy accessible, with very good Transit facilities! Mobile Libraries are also maintained in this society.

Central library is a great place where we can find lots of rare books. There is collection of different categories like literature, politics, economics, physics, chemistry etc. 

Moreover it is perfect place for people who are preparing for competitive exams as you find lots of books related to those exams. 

There is no library card facility, you cannot carry books outside.

It is a silent place to go and study for some time. All types of books are available here. Even if you want you can get your own personal books and study inside, library book are not allowed to outside. Place is located at the middle of coppon park. Parking for bikes and cycles is available. Library will be opened on all days except every Monday, second Tuesday and all general Holiday's.

A historic palace from Tipu Sultan age. Well maintained by the authorities. Mostly calm and quiet atmosphere. People come and go often. 
There is a well maintained garden around the palace.
Palace is also well maintained. We cam have a look at most of the areas around the place. 
There is also a small entrance fee to visit the palace, separate for natives and foreigners.

One of the old palace we can find in Bangalore. Its nicely maintained and historical place. We can hear stories of Tippu Sultan by guides. Must visit if you stay in Bangalore. And please never ever write something on wall of not only this but on any historic place. Its my humble request.

Decent place for history lovers. It's not a very big palace. Something that you can visit in the midst of Bangalore to put a tick to your bucket list. 

Should take 30-60 minutes to go through it fully!

Beautiful place to visit. Not much to see there because it is very small area, but interesting that such an old place is still standing still. With art works on the wall, and the wooden work done which is strong till now. Just the entry fee for Foreigners are too high, Govt. shouldn't impose such high entry fee to foreign tourists and no concession even if the foreign person is your wife or husband. INT 300 for entry for Foreigners is way too high compared to Indians Rs. 20.

Fairly well maintained summer palace of Tipu Sultan. Pops out like an oasis in the busy and fast city like Bengaluru. Some more/better services for tourists would have been nice. Please appreciate it is not a place with huge precincts. It's all about the 'structure'.

A historic palace from Tipu Sultan age. Well maintained by the authorities. Mostly calm and quiet atmosphere. People come and go often. 
There is a well maintained garden around the palace.
Palace is also well maintained. We cam have a look at most of the areas around the place. 
There is also a small entrance fee to visit the palace, separate for natives and foreigners.

One of the old palace we can find in Bangalore. Its nicely maintained and historical place. We can hear stories of Tippu Sultan by guides. Must visit if you stay in Bangalore. And please never ever write something on wall of not only this but on any historic place. Its my humble request.

Should take 30-60 minutes to go through it fully!

With art works on the wall, and the wooden work done which is strong till now. Just the entry fee for Foreigners are too high, Govt. shouldn't impose such high entry fee to foreign tourists and no concession even if the foreign person is your wife or husband. INT 300 for entry for Foreigners is way too high compared to Indians Rs. 20.

A beautiful structure nice to see
Nice structure.
Seat of Power
Government building
This is small temple beside big bazaar. It is clean and well maintained.
Jai Sri ram
Morning temple open timings?
Jai hanuman
Good response systmetic pooja all sevas available

A must visit temple in Bangalore. A very well maintained temple complex. The temple is very old and as per the available literature it is close to 400 year's old. The temple excavation was done in 90's. Parking is available at the road side. Temple is not wheelchair friendly.

This temple has a fascinating history. It disappeared from public memory in the 1920s and was rediscovered in the 1990s when excavations had commenced for a real estate development. Thankfully, the development was stopped and the temple has been restored to its original condition, including a small pond where one can now see fishes and turtles. 
An unique aspect of this temple is the steady stream of water that flows from the mouth of a Nandi statue on to the idol of Lord Shiva immediately below.

A must visit temple in Bangalore. A very well maintained temple complex. The temple is very old and as per the available literature it is close to 400 year's old. The temple excavation was done in 90's. Parking is available at the road side. Temple is not wheelchair friendly.

There is an unknown source of water which continuously streams out of the Nandi’s mouth which falls onto the Shivalinga and flows into Kalyani. This temple is an example of ancient art. This temple has been maintained neatly, you can also see fish and tortoises in the surrounding areas of the pond. Its exterior looks like a park which is a relaxing point. This temple is diagonally opposite to the Narshimaswamy temple. This is a divine place where  your wishes get fulfilled.
Lovely place for good Shiva darshan.. we get good peace of mind if you sit in front of lord shiva

The temple looks quite small from outside one might miss it. The idols are placed inside a small cave. The moment you step inside the temple the vibes are so powerful, you will be filled with different level of energy. There is something about the place which will make you blissful. The place is quite n well maintained.
Definitely a place to visit if you are in Bangalore.

A nice, old, clean Shiva temple built inside a cave where many other Lord's idol also present. One has to be physically fit and should be able to bend completely to see the complete cave temple.

It is nicely maintained by the board and many volunteers working here.

Ancient Shiva temple located in a cave with natural surroundings. Quiet location and abundant car and two wheeler parking. Believers in hindu religion will experience quite a lot of positive vibrations within temple premises
Ancient temple dedicated to lord Shiva. Excellent vibrations.. must place to visit

As we had gone a few days before Mahashivratri there was activity on to make arrangements for the big day. However being there in the morning one could feel the calm atmosphere. Being a cave temple one needs to bow down and enter the abode of Shiva.

Very cool, calm and settled place, There is a big hall for Meditation, where you can charge yourself for free, and also there is Small park with full Greenery, Buddha's statues, and all things related to Buddhism. There is a small book stall next to this where you can get all Buddha's related books and all fancy items related to Buddhism. You can get Buddha's paintings which are very cool. Staff and securities are very friendly, there is a proper stand for your shoes and place is very well maintained. It's worth the visit, if you have a time, visit once...
Peaceful place. Area is not big. But the Lish green silent place fills your heart with peace.

It's my second Home where  where I got a new life... Called Monk life...
Every Seeker of peace and happiness plz visit our Monastery.
A very calm place where you can find the real meaning of silence enough though it’s in the busiest road of Bangalore, maintained with high disciple and devotion! Amazing place for meditation
To me, this is the best place for meditation in Bangalore:) serene and beautiful ambiance.. I'd highly recommend this to anyone seeking for peace..

It's a great place to visit. 
The temple is really nice and we'll maintained.
Good architecture overall.

A nice old temple build in 1570
.   The structure of the temple is breathtaking,  with old sculptures of God Shiva,  Parvati,  Meenakshi,  Murugan & lord Ganesha
Located on the main bannerghatta road. Well maintained temple. Easily accessible from nearby residential areas.
I am not a believer, but have no problem for those who believe
Full of devotional vibes

Very good place for devotees. The temple is crowded as always. Food is served in the temple but should reach before 1 pm. Good to go early in the morning. It will be open in the evening as well. Easy to locate its located on the main road itself.

It is an famous and attracting temple of Bangalore. Must visit place of Bangalore. Very well maintained and peaceful place with small hill and filled with greenery. Surprised to see such peaceful and greenery place in prime location of the city. Best place to go with family.

Great ambiance, easy to spend the whole evening, Saturdays are usually crowded closes by 8.30 pm, make sure you are on the top of the mountain temple before 8 ish to be safe. Parking for 4 wheeler should be done behind the temple. 2 wheeler parking is easy. They provide free lunch at 12 noon on Saturday at the dining hall.

Nice big temple. It is an famous and attractive temple. Must visit place in Bangalore. There are 3 conventional halls. Very well maintained. Staffs are very friendly too. Two wheeler parking is fine but car parking is a challenge. A peaceful place with small hill filled with greenery. Location is good but in peak hours to reach the temple is a task cuz of traffic.

It is one of the oldest and most famous temple in Bangalore. A must visit place for tourists. It is in hill top with God Anjaneya and Ganesha, Shiva and Rama lords. Beautiful place and well maintained.

The people of this place are just into money making business. I wasn’t knowing they charge 150 bucks as Entry fees which is general entry and 250 bucks for Special entry. I felt like they are more interested in the money than the real prayers. After paying the entry fees they gave me a ticket were few programs were mentioned. After entering, few stops are there where you need to show the tickets and do particular prayings where also the donation boxes were there. You need not to give any donation there out of your will. Yes, if you are willing to then you go ahead. I went in afternoon so the floors were quit hot and because my footwear was kept outside it was very uneasy to walk in few areas. So I suggest better go either in morning time or  in evenings. Anyway the statue of Lord Shiva was worth seeing. And that was the only part I liked after I entered. I would have loved the place if the temple people were not into business and more about holy rituals.

Temple of Lord Shiva. A huge statue of Lord Shiva siting in meditation position is been erect here. Just situated in well approachable location, focuses on all holy location of Lord Shiva and benefits of meditation. One can buy passes for various pooja and attraction.. At last can sit in front of Lord and feel all positive vibes around. Must visit place.

This is good place. But the entry ticket prices are different like 150rs and 250rs. There is a ticket for 50rs. Normal days 50rs ticket and 150rs does not make any difference. Overall good place to visit within city limit but ticket prices are high. Temple closes by 8pm. Peaceful place.

This is good for one time visiting. You will feel good here. However, most commercial temple in the Bangalore. Basically, this is not a temple. Beaware, ask the tickets Rs 50 for entry only. Otherwise they will give you Rs.150 per head. If you are going there for pray purpose.

This temple has turned more into a business than a place of worship. The priests aren't interested in talking/worshiping but offerings. The environment is hardly peaceful. As if the entry ticket of 250/ is not enough, they ask for more money at every stage.
A temple build with Grace. Beautiful Stine carvings done to give a traditional look. A temple you can visit when your traveling towards Mysore just before the outskirts of Bangalore
It is a beautiful Temple. Early morning would be good to visit. I can say that this is one of the temple where you'll actually feel those positions vibrations.

One of my favourite temple. Once you enter the temple you will feel calm and relaxed. For special Pooja you need to pay RS.200 and 3 persons will be allowed inside and to sit for few minutes in front of the Goddess. Friday's will be very rush.
A very big temple space with a lots of positivity and peace. You can just sit near the main idol and feel the vibes there.

Great atmosphere and the first temple I visited in Bangalore. The deity is well wrapped in flowers and ornaments. The amazing lit face of the deity would really be so amazing to see and you would feel peaceful and positive after visiting this temple. 

Believe in yourself. You would start believing in yourself after visiting this temple.

This church was built more than 150 years ago and hence has historical significance. Even though it is situated at a crowded junction, you can feel the peace once you walk down the path from the entrance to the church. On stepping into it you get to see a glimpse of an era that has been preserved. The peaceful and holy atmosphere is most evident in the afternoon which was the time I chose to visit it.

Right at the heart of the city, this church is a perfect location for worship. Tree covered campus, ample parking space, neatly maintained gardens and buildings. Church is pretty old, still with the old chairs and benches, same old walls and floor. Under renovation now, a new look is expected.

Resting place for the traffic police men while they're not very busy, a breathing space for them.

It was built in 1851, for the British Regiment stationed in Bangalore. 
Built in the English Renaissance style, the church can accommodate 
700 people and is regarded as the largest "military" church in southern India. 
It has a congregation of over 450 families
The church was consecrated on 25 July 1852 and opened on 8 August, 1852. 
The original estimate of the construction was ₹27,000 (US$380)
After Independence, the church was taken over by the Christian Indian Military personnel 
and their families. It was called Holy Trinity Garrison Pastorate then.
The walls were lined with ornate marble murals and tablets, which spoke about 
great men and women who toiled for the church. They Used to conduct many programs for youth especially Troika. They have a best team for youth. On March 10th they conducted the Peace Rally for the Pulwama Terrorist Attack. Really its a good experience for me. I Love this Church

When I moved to Bangalore, my fiancé was going here so he took me here. It was away from where we stay so we started checking other Tamil places nearby but now we are regularly going there. It’s worth traveling there. Best place to worship, such a nice priest. They have a good worshipping culture. You can feel Almighty’s presence there. #myfavchurch
Always a church with deep history and architecture gives a nostalgic feeling. This Tamil church surely is one of the churches which makes me feel at home and gives me a blessed experience.

Often times its so hard to find a church which we can call a family, a home, place where you could connect with God, where you could find a balanced teachings, not a religious place to perform an act, caring pastor, caring people.

Ever since I have come here, its been a deliverance after deliverance, faith being lifted up in a set up which is more contemporary and a church in the context of urban culture. 
People from all walks of life who pray for you not shake hands or pass by on a sunday morning.

Deliverance and Healing is what this Church stands for coupled with passionate worship and love of the saints you sure gonna fall in love with this place, God is sure in this place and his presence is awesome week after week, we encourage people to show their talent unto God.

so if you are tired of the tradition or simply need a time in the presence of God to find rest, this is sure the place to be.

See you there.
One on one fellowship. Raw doctrine. Love centred.

U want a Chruch like a family...then its IPA shelter house...u want 2 worship with ur heart n soul....then its IPA shelter house...u want 2 b guided by a spiritual leader...den its IPA shelter house bengaluru.
Miss you all....i wish we can have a early morning service soon.

Each one will have different personal problems but the only place to get relief is our shelter house. Really i have experienced many changes after going to our shelter house. i am very thankful to god for making me a member of this holy house.

Good range of books and an ambience to indulge in thumbing the eye catching titles, with a good spread of gadgetry and toys. Surprising to see decline in the range offered in diaries and calendars while a rise in generic stationary items. Highly trending in non fiction titles is another aspect of 2019 at landmark books arena.. Very encouraging changes in layout of stores, so that one feels like spending time there.

One of the best places to go to if you're a person who just loves spending your time amongst books. They have the perfect collection of books.. books of all categories.. also a comic book haven for comic book fans. They have a dedicated section when people can read books too. 
Apart from books, they have a wide collection of toys for children as well as action figures for collectibles and enthusiasts. 
Fashion accessories, unique forms of diaries, office supplies, bags, mugs, and chocolates are some of the other things that can be found here.

I had been to Landmark which is in Forum, it has developed over a timeframe as far as inside and quality also. Milestone is one stop arrangement on the off chance that you are a book significant other. You have all the assortment of books running from anecdotal, magazines, recorded, instructive and so forth. They have great assortment of books for children too, I like the flawless story books for them.

The games activity is likewise great and contains all the fundamental necessities for all the game. We had purchased a cycle from that point, the conveyance for which was entirely quick. A dazzling spot for book significant others.

Nice place to find books..... And you also get cute stuffs... Not to mention the toy section.... Oh boy!!! .... Doesn't matter how old I get, I will always go in there to check out those cute stuffed toys and marvel avenger figures!!

The shop is good. The collection of books and games is good ( online price is much cheaper). But the staff is untrained. They asked me debit card pin stating ATM machine under charging instead of asking cash as alternative. They did not serviced me to another queue for payment. The payment processing takes more than 30 minutes in queue. Very slow staff.

Hands down this is one of the best place for authentic Mangalorean cuisine and seafood in Bangalore. Lip-smacking chicken ghee roast which is worth dying for!
Great ambiance and a friendly staff.
Be it the food or the service, you will not be disappointed. Great job you guys!
Mangalore style food. Ghee roast dishes are terrific. Very nice ambiance. Good service. Properly priced.
Worth the price. The quality and quantity of the food served is really good. Do try their chicken clear soup.
Great ambience and if you happen to visit this place, please don't miss the ghee roast! ❤️

A must visit restaurant for the foodies. Yummy food with great ambience. Good service. Anjal masala fry and prawns biriyani were awesome. Paneer ghee roast and neer dosa is a must try. Authentic Mangalorean restaurant.

One of the greatest food is being served here. Staff is also friendly and servicing is little bit late here. No car parking in front of it and also no place for two wheeler parking in front of it. It's a very good place to visit and also nice place to eat. And it's got an award also. Nice old architecture

This is a great place to have ಬೆಣ್ಣೆ ಮಸಾಲೆ ದೋಸೆ and the prices  are moderately priced which makes it a good place for a group of 10+ people as well. The ambience is great and so is the service. You might have to wait for ~10/15 minutes to get a table but worth the wait. Considering the food, ambience, service, cost I'd rate this place a 9/10. Would have rated this 10 if there were more tables.
New Darshini. New one so looks clean. But staff is not so experienced. So there may be some order goof ups. Careful about that. Food taste was good. There is a chance to improve food taste.

Good traditional food but, personally I feel it is overrated. The taste and quality is good, with the service and the pricing, one would expect something else. Again, it is surely worth a try when in Bangalore as this is one of the oldest restaurants and we all would get a different feeling once entered here!

Love to spoil your diet?
This is the place to be
Dosas are a charm here and also it's very greasy as they put lots of butter or ghee..

With *no parking* signs all over.. bringing a 4 wheeler can be a mistake..
Come early or else you've got to wait for a long time...

Lovely Place to be. Lot's of variety in Ice creams. Superb price range. The place is not very big but you can enjoy the ice creams here. I love this place. They have take away option also with them. They accept Food card, debit card and all other payment options*. Highly Recommended...

Excellent location, parking mainly on the main road and side roads. Friendly staff, very fast service, hassle free service. Corner house has chosen right place to serve right people. Ambiance is not so great. Rates are inline with Corner House standards. Keep good work guys !

This is a very good place to eat ice cream and chill with your friends and family. The staff is really good and serve really fast. The place is cleanly maintained and they also have a washroom. Also do Try the death by chocolate highly recommend.

Well as the name like wise, this corner house is located in the corner of the building but easily noticeable. Ample space for parking. So budge in and gorge on their irresistible ice creams and what not! Happy ice creams to you.

They should rename their fresh strawberries to reflect how fresh they actually are. Cut in the morning and sold as fresh strawberries. Not good enough for 160 Rs.

Sad to see one of the decent places around cutting corners.

Empire, a name that makes me salivate for their Chicken Kebab, which is also their specialty. It's absolutely delectable and a must-try item at Empire. This restaurant is famous for serving Arabian and Malabar cuisines but they also have Chinese and North Indian food in their menu. Empire is popular for their non-vegetarian food.
We ordered Chicken Kebab and Grilled Chicken in the starters. I was surprised to see that the portions were large and sufficient enough for two people. In fact, we had no appetite left for the main course after having this much. Grilled Chicken was not very impressive to me but the Kebab was really very tasty.
The ambience is nice with beautiful decor and bright lighting. The service is excellent and the staff is polite and courteous.

Been here a few times when traveling for work. One of the best places at this price range. 

Very comfy, clean rooms that are reasonably spacious and a great location. Well trained and professional housekeeping staff.

Hoping that they maintain this for long.

This was my second time stay with empire Koramangala.

Good food, friendly room service staff and receptionists. 

Overall it was a great stay but they charged me Rs. 700 extra inspite of early check in inclusion in my trip details... 

Overall good stay but won't prefer the same next time.. Thank you.

Tasty food. Excellent service. Good hygiene. If u are planning for a treat with your family or friends this is fine. We have excellent complement offers and this is the superb restaurant in Koramangala where u ll find find everything under one roof

It's a good one. But starter quantity are less compared to price. Taste good most of it. Buy briyani by plates rather than combo. Prawn, fish or mutton. Squid fry tasted good.  Do not order pitcher it's waste of money. Better buy individual glass of drinks like lemonade or soda

Visited today with my friend. With his influence.

The taste was good. 

But we have to wait for some time to get the food which we ordered.

Ordered masala dosa(Received token on pay at the token counter) and given for the delivery person.( There are multiple persons are standing in the delivery counter). Many people are already waiting for the ordered food. Delivery persons are taking tokens from the People and giving items. 

But what I noticed is there is no policy of "first come first serve". They are just giving the items who's ready to receive.

And I was also surprised that even they are not aware of whether they are giving the items to the right people or not.

And also I observed that some people are waiting at the table(Table serve).

Finally we received our items from one person at the delivery counter (I'm not sure he's is the one who received the token from us).

The taste was super. Enjoyed the food.

Gives a old time experience,  very good  masala dosa at reasonable rate. They have maintained the hotel just as it must have been decades back when they had started. Only morning and evening. But very busy road,  difficult to  find parking
Good quality food, good services. and reasonable rate.

Mangalore bajji and masala dosa are 2 hot saleable items, a decade back Vada was the most favourite among the Malleswaram people with hot tangy sambar, but these days the sambar is just ordinary and lacks the old charm the hotel commanded by the Bangaloreans - frequenting this hotel for the past 4 and half decades regularly

A old Bangalore charm with its own special vibe. Place is not modern or it's not a fine dining stuff. It's classic place and when you enter it you feel the authenticity.

Must try item
Masala Dosa
Badam burfi
Janani clinic is awesome the dr takes ultimate care of patient

Doc treats my sister inlawnd mom.  Both are highly content with her medical advises Nd recommendations. She yes genuinely listens to your health issues nd recommend medications. Her patience to share her family experiences related to the prescribed medicines are appreciated.

Dr Radha S Rao is the best Obstetrician and gynaecologist we have seen. Investigations and treatment are done following international guidelines. Best thing is she helps you to understand  the problems and helps us choose the best option.
All the things are good and staffs are friendly. Doctor is also good. Just they are short of seating space which doesn't help when the queue is long and you have to wait for hours.

One of the worst doctor i  have seen in my life. There's doctor name is  Radha S Rao and she is a very soft robber. Apart from here she is sitting in Appolo Cardle Hospital jayanagar, Shanthi Hospital & Research Centre jayanagar and Shanti Nursing Home Jayanagar. If you are going for treatment with her be sure you will get fleece. So, beware before going there.

The chat items of Kanti sweets and Pav Bhaji are really amazing. That is the reason I go there again and again. The sweets there are also amazing. The service they provide is also good. And they maintain a high level ho hyginece also. Overall it is a very nice experience of going to Kanti sweets
I've visited Bellandur branch.  It was not crowded one,  may be the reason is they have less options as compare with other branches. Though I get what I want. Sweets was fresh.
Very good sweets. Best part is that they do home delivery as well.

Good place to buy sweets. Quality of sweets is nice based on the price range. Almost all types of sweets are available except famous sweets of some particular states. Anyway Very good sweets shop available in almost all major area of Bangalore.

Very good place to have so any varieties of sweets. Though it's costly its worth tasting sweets there.
It is good place for corporate gifting as their packing is also looks good.
Bus services to Kasaragod and Kanhangad from Bangalore and forth... Good service with punctual on timing and good staff behaviour and cheaper.

Best service, "Kasaragod note swantham Kohinoor".
Easy to book tickets just by a phonecall. They give more impotance to the passengers. Comfort journey for Ladies. Even they are ready to wait till some one come pick the women passengers from d dropping point. Especially during early mornings. 
I am regular Traveller in Bangalore-Kasaragod route.
Daily services to kerala >Bangalore. Safe
Best Service......  On time ...... Reliable
It's in Gandhinagar and the quality of the service is not up to the mark. Office is too small and conjusted.

I am not from Bangalore but decided to give this Hotel a visit after reading the online feedback's.Good that all those feedback's were genuine. AS everyone told it is an old traditional ,authentic hotel which serves you good ,healthy,tasty foods.One good thing i observed about this hotel is ,no matter whether you are a bunch of people or single ,the amount of attention you get remains the same.Don't forget to try the filter coffee here.Its taste will still remain in your tongue for 30 mins after you had this one .Must visit  :)
One of my favourite place. Dosa here is an attraction to me. I would recommend everyone to try this out at least once.

Much Famous Breakfast Point in Bengaluru. 
There is usually a wait time here - i.e., you might have to wait in queue outside to get your table inside - this is done in a disciplined first come first serve basis by the staff.

Food is served quick and hot - taste and quality is great!
Coffee is a must try!
As a personal choice I usually go for the Mini Breakfast Combo.

The pricing is a bit on the higher scale and parking space is ample.

Very nice place for families and students.
Very nice test and popular area..
Delicious food serve..
Food service is excellent..
Love this place.. 👌😘
Meals was good. But orange and mausambi juice was bitter in taste. When we asked for replacement they refused to do. Please don't go for juice and dessert.

A great place to have some great food. There are some dishes in the menu not up to the mark, but overall, the food is really good. The menu also has quite a large variety, so that's nice. But, the thing is that the service here has deteriorated over the past year, the waiters before were energetic and ready to serve. That has changed and they've been replaced by nonchalantly working people, the service wasn't the best. The tables were not properly cleaned. But that was solved soon enough. Other than that, a pretty good place to hang out with family and friends.
Good hotel. Good taste. But expensive rates. Best for family and friends.

Pathetic place the service is horrible. The staff is the worst of all while you are eating your food staff would keep annoying you sir shall I get the bill. I was really frustrated by the service and staffs behavior so I left only a few coins as the tip where the staff come and says if you want to tip give me 10 rs or take this coins he doesn't needs it. When I took the issue to the counter admin he rather supports the staff and asks me to leave from there. I told him why should I tip you 10 rs for your pathetic service plus you kept annoying me saying shall I get the Bill some 10 times. On top of all this the food wasn't good it was ok ok. Average food average ambiance and the attitude of an 7 star hotel. It was a really pathetic experience. The staff and the counter admin were horrible.
Nice place but at a weird side of junction.... Parking issues and too many customers as it's the only veg restaurant on that side of road.... Hence delayed service

Good place and nice ambience.  Little bit congested seating. 
South indian food was good. 
Tried Chinese,  but did not like it due to too much of oil.

Same taste 24/7... Tea at its best. Loved it
You can go there anytime. No matter it's midnight or evening or morning... You can still taste the same classic tea with their trademark taste. Another specially is a lemon tea.. you can't find those good tea anywhere else in Bangalore. As a chai lover, I love to visit this place at last twice a month.
If u want a good tea aftrr 12 midnight or early morning .its a best place
Nice Tea but forget cleanliness, not very clean but can't blame as the are itself is not clean due to Meat and poultry market beside it...
Nice tea. Great place to hang out with friends. Not a place for families

Best tea in the town!!
The tea here is on a different level

If you are looking for the finest vegetarian food then this place it is. The best starters, main course and desserts and not to forget the staff. Several branches all across Bangalore. There one in MG Road is definitely a treat to be at. It's on point for it's ambience, decor, cordial staff and definitely food.
A must try here is the sizzling brownie sundae. Every dish has a unique taste to it and it's different from the other. It's one of the finest Bangalore has to offer for vegetarians.

This is an awesome restaurant with a variety in cuisines. Being an Indian restaurant, the quality of the foreign cuisine is out of the box. Their service is quick with the waiters being very quick in action. This is a must visit restaurant and deserves more customers.

Love the service here and the hygiene levels. The food is legitimately deliciously but also very rich if you order stuff that might contain cream or butter. Their baby kulchas are amazing and so are Chinese dishes. Desserts seem a bit pricey, but the fresh fruits are a welcome change from processed desserts with loads of sugar. Easily one of the best vegetarian restaurants in the locality.
Captains are a bit too casual. We had difficulty in getting their attention for additional services. Quite fast service though. Staff need to be more cordial.
Another veg restaurant from shiv Sagar group. Much needed around MG ROAD / BRIGADE ROAD situated in public utility building. Good options....good ambience...good taste.
Been shopping here since 10yrs , it has become like family tradition now , Shri Krishna’s staffs are amazing :).. specially Kushal !!
Quality, price and service is very best here. Always pleasure and value for money shopping here
Excellent designs, great making and finish. Unmatchable designs especially antique ones
Variety of silver products. Courteous. Centrally located
Good selection of jewellery, located in com street. Good customer service. This is one place you need to visit if you are looking for some jewellery. Has options for all occasions.

It is a decent place. They have fast food in the ground floor and service at the 1st floor. Toilet facility available in the First floor. There is need of a lift here for aged customers. Food is good and tasty.

Cheap, tasty food for all. I love how flexible their menu is. The north and south Indian menus are great and they keep improving the snack and appetizer sections. The newly added pasta might not be great, but the other food is pretty good if you're short on cash and you want a quick fix.

Upahara Darshini is a nice, quick and kinda healthy option for a snack or meal when you're in the area. This probably is the quickest and best bet for if you're at Cloudnine for a visit.

They have a pay and eat standing option that's pretty quick or there is also a service hall one level above the street.

The food is pretty decent and nominally priced too.

The worst service ever.. They don't even treat their customers properly when some issue raised.. I had very bad experience with this particular outlet. I ordered for jamoons in bulk and it wasn't even properly baked. When I raised this query the person who was on other side was too rude. He wasn't even ready to hear to my issue. Overall I hate this outlet n never ever want to visit here.

The food here is good. Nominal price, fine taste.
The ice cream scoops are really good and worth the price.
Blackcurrant's a must try, if you like the flavor.
Cheers

Timeless taste. They do a few dishes and they do them very well. But it comes at the cost of your diet. Lot of oil and butter but that's what gives the taste. Hard to find the place, it's a bit in road, but ask anyone and they will direct you properly. Don't expect a great ambience. The focus is only on the food. Prices are very reasonable. Must visit in Bangalore.

This place used to be amazing, but these days they have lost the quality of the food, one of the best place  that had the best rating for food but you can visit this once to feel it yourself. service is great and ambience is old school just the way it was when it started. must visit once atleast. i wouldn't visit this place again. this place is always crowded it's time they expanded into a bigger place with faster service.

Earlier when we were kids, we used to visit the place regularly. The taste of food was awesome. Now a days It is not as it used to be, quality is reduced drastically only people are rushing for the name sake which they would have heard from others. They have to get back the old taste, for which people were crazy.
Good to coin it as a historic place rather than a great restaurant. Food, restaurant & service all below average. Would recommend anyone to go & see from outside rather than eating there.

This iconic joint in Bangalore is easy to miss. They have the most amazing traditional Dosas. The filter coffee is almost perfect and the prices too seem to be from the time the restaurant was established. Really affordable, great food. Service can be a little tough and old school. Please check the timings before you go and it's usually pretty crowded.
Good restaurant. Mutton is really good. Don't miss to try Persian lemonade.
Really good ambiance but I ordered kunafa which wasn't cheesy at all. Dint even taste like one

The restaurant itself seems to have been thrown together with little care, and left to rot. There were 2 nonplussed staff who didn't even know how to operate a debit card machine. Soft drinks were served tepid at best, and the building itself was undergoing construction, which meant noises 24/7. The only saving grace was the food, and barely. The bhatkali biryani was okay and the hummus was actually quite decent (but then you overcharge for it!) Avoid the restaurant, order home delivery if you have to.

Fabulous food! Located in the first floor of a building in Frazer Town, this turned out to be a real gem. We had Koobideh kebab, Bhatkali mutton biriyani and Chicken Maqluba - aiddle Eastern upside down rice dish served with vegetables. All of them were quite authentic and delicious! End your dinner with a pot of Morrocan mint tea or qahwa (Arabic coffee). Totally worth it. :)
Excellent food good service tried their konafa and mixed grill

Nice place located in Public Utility Building, 2nd floor, MG Road.

It's suitable for get together of 150-200 people.

It has sufficient parking space 

Food is good both veg and non veg.

Ambiance is very nice.
The open balcony area is very good in evening time with cool breeze
Awesome banquet hall for all occasions! Located at centre place. Maintained well.

This is over priced place. Don't book for weddings. Food always become short and service is poor in general. Be careful of the way they count plates... Too many complaints about marriages here..  Food is average for the price you pay. Better get a good cook.
A beautiful cute place for a small party of around 300 guests! Everyone loved the decor and the staff is quite helpful!
Located on MG road, this place is easily accessible. Good food and ambience.

A good meeting spot for short client meeting.
Value for money, Delicious food. Get to eat all kind of egg dishes. 

The disadvantage is there is no proper parking space. And because of metro construction there is lot of dust. And also I could find Cockroaches in the sitting area, I hope there is no cockroach in the kitchen.

All time favourite restaurant for breakfast, brunch, lunch or in short, any time of the day. Now that they have introduced chicken, it's just perfect hence the extra star. From pastas to dozens of mouth watering egg preparations,  breakfast menu, burgers.. they have it all. Could improve a bit on the drinks menu
Great place for egg lovers. I feel it's priced little high.. Taste is good.. Amebience is nice.. And a great place to hang out also..
We ordered 3 items, all tasted exactly what they were supposed to. So food quality & taste awesome. Ambience good. But expensive. Rs-541 for these 3 items.
I have visited here once. I ordered a Classic French Toast which was really good. The place and the service is also nice.

Been seeing this place for a while when I pass through. Even heard a lot. Finally made my visit today. It's like a proper Indian coffee House setup but serves alcohol. It's spacious and you will get the same 90's ambiance inside. The place with a heritage and it shows in every corner. Simple menu, long conversation, vintage ambiance - it's totally different ambiance. Everyone will have that sort of place in mind and Koshy's that. In short it's a old school cafe. The taste is superb here and lamp cutlet is a must try here. They have their own way to serve food and get people in there.

"It's Popular but..."
I was here on a Friday morning for brunch. The place it old in heritage. I had a Ham Sandwich, Mutton Omlet and Chicken Puff, ending with a special coffee. The meal was very pricey and taste was moderately okay. I feel that it wasn't worth the hype it has.

Total disappointment. We had Beef steak, lamb burger, mutton sandwich. None of these had any flavours. The lamb was burnt. The sandwich didn't have any fillings whatsoever. For such expensive dishes all the 4 items ordered was a total disappointment. The burger and sandwich didn't have any fillings or wasn't grilled. It was just patty between two bread. Good ambiance and service was the only upside to this restaurant.

We went to dinner here along with our Customers from the USA. Customer himself suggested this place since he studied in Bangalore some 30+ years back. Nice place. Service was quick and good. Tastes also good.

Koshys is more of heritage cafe than anything else. The ambiance is the attraction as the food pricing is really in the costly side. But the old day charm is there. Food is also tasty. It's great for a Sunday brunch.

Don't order from here as if you fall asleep you don't get your order or your money back so please don't order from little Italy pizza really bad review go to pizza hut as its a lot better than this place

I moved out of Aberdeen a year ago and what a loss it is not to have Little Italy around.. I simply cannot find a pizza restaurant with the same quality pizzas as this.

Expand! And for every newcomers, I highly recommend the Little Italy Calzone 12" if you like a bit spicy food!
Their sizes are a bit on the small side but otherwise great value for your money.

I went and ordered food throigh their website. The order was rejected due to them being too busy which I totally understand. However they proceeded to charge me twice and took the money out of my account. I emailed them and have not received any response. I am really not happy with this and this is slmesomet that people need to be avare off

The pizza is very good. I would say 7/10. I have tried the piri piri one and calzone. The number of ingredients in calzone is perfect. No option to order garlic sauce. Only garlic mayo available which taste very average. It is so easy to make garlic sauce, it should be a problem for the pizza place. The delivery time was shocking, 1:35, during the week. I cannot imagine waiting time during the peak times. Furthermore, the place is quite dear. It is not real Italian pizza therefore price should be lower. Why do I need to pay extra fee while ordering online through your website. I see the potential but some changes must be done.

Frankly I had never been to a Mainland China before. But this place made me wished why didn't I do that. We had ordered Noodles and Rice, exotic vegetable gravy and spring rolls. Everything tasted really good. Service was excellent. The ambience serves as a really nice place to go for a lunch/dinner with family.

A great place for a team lunch or family outing. They have buffet at reasonable rates every day if the week.  Situated in church landing road it is easily accessible from most of the parts of the city.  The metro exit extends right into the road.  It is a one way and would be better to reach there in an auto or car

The buffet was simply completely off the mark. They had 3 non vegetarian starters, a main course with non vegetarian gravies - you need to have then with veg fried rice or noodles. 

I would have been fine if the starters tasted very good but it was not the case. A fish starter was good but none of the others. Now for the reason for 2 stars Ave not less... Their ice tea was fantastic and all my colleagues agreed their cocktails were nice. Another star because they asked for our feedback and got some prawns that tasted nice.

I suggest you skip the buffet here. Not worthy of 900+ per head.

First time to mainland China.. eye soothing decor, peaceful ambience.. delicious food.. courteous service.. but kept asking feedback for every dish served which kinda bothered.. hence a star less from 5.. overall fine dine experience by leaders..

I had always heard the hype about Mainland China but had not got a chance to try for so many years. So finally couple of weeks back we dropped in here for lunch unplanned. Luckily we got the table without having to wait. 

So we took buffet lunch & starters were served on table. I loved the fish in starters & chicken was also nice. In veg there was potato & corn dishes which was ok. Few beverages were part of buffet & I took lime juice which was very strong lime juice, definitely good when having buffets(for diet conscious !! ) :P Jokes apart !! next took the main course chicken fried rice was authentically Chinese which I had not tasted else where. Also other dishes were authentic Chinese saucy dishes which was tasty & great Chinese food. Dessert section had the mousses, cakes & ice creams which was the usual ones. I was hoping to see some Chinese desserts which would make it a complete Chinese food ! At the end they gave a Chinese tea which was good too!

Ambiance is great & loved the interior decors. Cost for food was worth it.

Best place to unwind...especially if you love rock music!  Very attentive staff. I love the appetizers and the main course! Tried pizza, fried rice, chicken n potato sides...Yummy! Worth your money...they don't overcharge you...Try it! :)

It's a awesome pub situated in MG road, Bangalore. Disco upstairs and rock music downstairs. Food items are good. You have They serve beer in bottle, either you have to order a tower beer(3litre) or a beer jug ( minimum 500ml) Happy hours available. Nice ambience.Great place to hangout with friends.

It's a awesome pub situated in MG road, Bangalore. Disco upstairs and rock music downstairs. Food items are good. You have They serve beer in bottle, either you have to order a tower beer(3litre) or a beer jug ( minimum 500ml) Nice ambience.Great place to hangout with friends.

Drinks are regular, usual cocktail choices and not pricey. Food is good, not great. Service is fast. Ambience is ok, with lot of rock music memorabilia. Loved the classic Rock played. Pub with 3 floors and scary stair, is not practical. Parking is non-existent and wouldn't recommend getting there by own car.

Always a great place to visit... They have a great setup with the correct music, drinks and food... The staff is very helpful... They have dedicated smoking area which is the entire 2nd floor... Overall a must visit place for rock music lovers ;)

You would love the ambience for sure, no question about it! If you are a party of more than 4, then you would have to adjust on the platform and won't get reservation inside the train, but it's okay, you can take pictures later! Haha..
Coming to food, NEVER EVER order a platter in starters! They charge exorbitant price for nothing- like 2k for non veg platter which suffices mere 3 ppl and 1.5k for Veg!!! Keep away from committing this mistake and you ll enjoy the food there!
Drinks were fine, we ordered mocktails and everything was above average.
Food is on the spicy side, so I enjoyed the main course though people not used to spicy might need some water!
The dessert sampler was delightful as well! ☺
Do visit but be wary of platters!

Great ambiance here. As it is at all places, theme is based on railway. So if you're in a group of 4 or less, you will get a reservation for having food inside train. Food quality is good, a bit on spicy side, which I like. Price wise, it is a bit on expensive side, which makes your wallet lighter.

Nice ambiance. The restaurant is modeled after a train station from the 1960s(?). You can choose to sit on the railway station platform or in the train cars. There is train announcements too! The food is really tasty and very easy to go overboard! Chicken dishes suggested by the waiter was finger-licking good.

The ambiance and food were excellent. I really enjoyed it. They have an exotic menu themed after old British India.
Service could be improved though. They served me a nan when I ordered a kulcha and were making lots of noise near my table talking/coordinating between themselves.

The order was served after 30 minutes. Not that it had very fancy and intricate items. Just a couple of Indian non-veg dishes. The ingredients were good but the preparation lacked the punch. Hardly anything to relish about. And finally, the heaviest part of the lunch, the bill. Net to net, it was a disappointment.

The food is average. Good ambience & friendly staff. Usually not overcrowded. Good place for a family lunch/ dinner. There's parking available but it isn't a valet service. I'm not sure what would happen if the parking is full.
Mutton dum biryani was good. Ambience is captivating and Service was good. Not light on your pocket though, additional 10% service charge was not a pleasant feeling.
Mango season you go there... And you will find lots of varieties of mangoes.... Awesome for vegetarians
Good food with authentic Afghani cuisine. Fine ambience. Food is bit expensive with 1300 for 2 people on an average but its worth the money once in a while.

Nice... Nice.... Nice.... Just that's all I have to say...   I love all bout this place.... Good food.... Good staff....  And a very silent place.... Quality time kind of place.... Biriyani here is must try....  The menu here makes me search for food....
Went for the new year's lunch with family and was amazing. The food and spread were great. It was topped with the presence of a mentalist and live band
Superb ambience. Fantastic service. The Sunday buffets are fun. Go there for a great experience.
food was good.. service is also good except the food was served a little late.  must try fish tikka here it was very tasty.
It was an okay experience. The coffee was good but the atmosphere was pretty noisy due to a party at the club next to the cafe.
Nice food. Nice ambience. Looking forward for next visit
I love techno. Prices are fine , Don't dare to order food though.... I love the Ambience... Trippers place... Nice crowd... Enjoy the music and take a look around the town then glance on the moon
Tasty food, good ambience, excellent service.
Great food, great service what else can you ask for............ the people here are really good and look after you. Preference of food is also given if ur unsure. Will be back soon .

One of my fav places in India. I love Indian food and this was a French place but they did it right. Seared foie was the best ive ever had anywhere. The chef would custom make me a 12 course choice menu and he would always nail it on every dish
Very good

Anthony is great. His suggestions on menu selection is very helpful. Ambiance of restaurant is v good. Food tests fantastic. Overall great place to spend evening with family and friends.
All the very best 😍

The restaurant is inside of the Gateway Hotel, so if you go downstairs and to the back you will find like a small hidden garden and from there starts the restaurant. Since you get in, you will love it. The service was incredible amazing, they helped us to pick the food. All what we ordered was delicious. I always like to try new things. We got fish and calamaris with a bottle of wine. I think it’s a place for you to enjoy the food. It’s not cheap but every money you will spend there it will be worth it. It will depend on the quality of food that you choose. I also really loved that they consume fish in the months that should be. They treat food with love. It was our best dinner in Bangalore and for sure I would be glad to come back to eat there.

Everything about this place is amazing.... Firstly the place and the way it is maintained is just awesome .... I'm a mother of a three year old . .. one of those  place s that is completely child friendly- so much place for kids to move around... my bub loves kane fry here and we love everything that is offered here... Chicken ghee roast is a must try 😍😍😍😍😍😋😋😋😋😋 

It's Delicious food and lovely people who serve you... Thank you so much Mr. Anthony and Mr. Benjamin ... After a very long time we had a great sit down lunch for 2.5 hours.... Will be meeting you as often as possible.... you both are lovely

To go to place whenever you have a craving  for lovely coastal food... 😍😍😍😍😍😍

Really great atmosphere, good food. Probably the most expensive place I've eaten in Bangalore, but still reasonable. The restaurant is located outside, kind of behind the hotel. Good place to relax outside, enjoy some good food and drinks.

The place is lush green and beautiful. Perfect place for a dinner date with tasty coastal food. Must try the Ghee roast here. Would love to visit this place again at day time. Ambience-5/5 Food-5/5 Staff and Service -5/5

Went there for a Saturday Buffet date with wife and we had a great evening. The place has nicely set up the ambiance for a romantic dinner date  They serve some really good  food, spread was limited but nicely curated. The desert section was my favorite as it had a lot of variety.

Not at all a great place at that price. Nothing great about ambience or food. Small place actually. Staff service is good and courteous. Less staff. You need to go hotel reception to pay your bill. No ice cream in the desert.
Food is good but limited starters in buffet. ambience was good. If you want have some privacy like closed doors environment I would suggest not to choose monsoon

A descent place to dine-in. Courteous staff and good service.

Food - we tried pizza, pasta and desserts. Pizza was very good but pasta disappointed a bit in terms of taste and quality. The raspberry cheesecake was not good but chocolate bomb was unique.
Ambience - average.
Service - very good staff.

It's been quite some time and we were craving for buffet lunch. After looking for multiple options, we found this to be better than others. This buffet was labelled as fit and healthy so we were also excited for some amazing healthy stuff. Since we reached there just when the buffet started so we thought main course items are yet to be kept. To our greatest surprise there was no main course. So the menu comprised of salads and desserts which is so weird and bizarre. The only main course option was cold burger and cold sandwich which was terrible. Except for khao suey soup and couple of salads n desserts, majority of the offerings were average to below average. The most horrific of all was papadi chaat where the ingredients were papadi and dahi, neither it was healthy nor justified to not put basic ingredients. Healthy doesn't mean non inclusion of basic items. With salads which anyways is an indispensable part of the buffet plus umpteen desserts which has nothing to do with healthiness this buffet was the worse ever experience so far. Coming to their service, it was again not even close to what we expected. The serving folks lacked basic skills in regard to everything. The only sigh of relief was the ambience which was surely in line with what we expected. Overall not suggested in any case!!!

Despite our expectations, food quality was above average and the service was just average!! They served starter and main course at the same time to different guests!!!! Salad was not what we ordered and a hefty amount was billed!! Definitely not worth what was paid and the distance paved to get there.

I arrived and was very warmly welcomed. The food was excellent. 2 staff were very nice, explaining what the food was. Ms Manisha and Mr Shiva were particularly nice. Nothing was too much trouble for both of them. The service is impeccable, the people wonderful and the food was incredible..a definite must whether you stay in Bangalore or are visiting...A definite recommanded place to eat while in Bangalore.

You will get a better tomato soup in any regular snack restaurant.. You do not need a 5* hotel for that.. Veg biriyani was not done according to some specific instructions given.... Filter coffee was not fresh and just warm... Over all a bad experience..
Excellent food. Excellent service by the chefs and waiters. All are experts in their fields and in true sense. They make you feel at home.

Everything was good and posh but the main Indian dishes were not bad, just so so and not many options in my opinion. Salad, dessert were very good and every bread was really excellent. Staff were very kind friendly.

Great food and great service. If you want to taste the authentic North Karnataka cuisine then this is definitely the place. The quality and the quantity of the food is really very good and so is the service. Variety of vegetable curries along with salads served on plantain leaf which lets you experience the authentic village quintessence. Even the ambiance is amazing. Overall visiting and experiencing this place is worth every penny you spend.

I am a foodie... I am a pure vegetarian... I love authentic / traditional food items more than any other cuisines...

An authentic North Karnataka style food is served in a traditional style, serving food on  BANANA LEAF,...

Must visit once.

500 for two for unlimited meal.

Good south Indian type restaurant and great taste. 

Usually we have to wait for our seat if there is a holiday. 

Best known for afternoon south Indian meals.

We went on a weekday around 3. Had heard a lot it (good things). Was bitterly disappointed as food was cold, pooranpoli was prepared last night. Honestly speaking you can have your food someplace else as the taste was also not good. Giving 2 stars for shear hospitality of the staff. Lot of better options are around, rather than this.

Soft jowar rotis, Traditional Karnataka meal served in a banana leaf. Tasty, healthy and authentic. 

Courteous staff, with very good service. Highly, recommended!
Ambiance is good but not the taste. Found far better taste in other MTR joints than this one.

Great South Indian dishes, huge variety from Dosas, uttapom, puri and thali sets. The staff is nice, the space is clean and well kept, the kitchen has a window where you can see how clean the cooking kitchen environment is. The drinks, lassi and flavored milk is too sweet for my taste but I guess that is true to the authenticity.

Very good.. Fantastic place for weekend breakfast with family.. very courteous manager Karthik and his colleagues taking care of you well.. told the place is going go for renovation...I am sure it will regain it's glory in looks once after its renovation...food taste wise still it is keeping its standard which was there even 5year back...
Must visit place for a weekend breakfast.....

Very good.. Fantastic place for weekend breakfast with family.. very courteous manager Karthik and his colleagues taking care of you well.. told the place is going go for renovation...I am sure it will regain it's glory in looks once after its renovation...food taste wise still it is keeping its standard which was there even 5year back...
Must visit place for a weekend breakfast.....
Great food, a huge variety of options. I especially enjoyed the different types of gravies. Reception and service could be improved a little bit. Overall, a great experience.
Great-tasting South Indian food. Lots of variety in the buffet on Sunday. The service was exceptional. Highly recommended.
Good place to visit with family. Authentic South Indian food. Recommend the appam and stew combination

Portland has a more diverse menu than other steakhouses in Bangalore. The steaks are excellent albeit a bit more expensive than peers. Tried a veg starter (onion rings), which was excellent, and a veg pizza (Mediterranean), which was disappointing. Overall it's a much better option for mixed veg-non veg groups.

Note that the place is not air conditioned. Service is good.

Nice place for stakes, burgers, pizza etc. The food and the spritzers we had were done very nicely. The chickpeas salad was average... The ambience and the set up is nice, but not on a hot and humid evening. Wish they had aircon since the pedestal fans they have simply are not enough when it's really hot. Recommend visiting this place in winters or when it's relatively cooler...

Tried the chicken steak, their ribeye, cherry pie and house wine.

Great experience. 

We had a lovely server, so service was a delight. 

Food was great. Portions didn't look so big but kept me full for the next 12 hours, so they were good on that. The pie- i loved the pastry bit more than the filling-so warm and crumbly and awesome

The food and the ambience are definitely awesome, no complaints on that front. The ambience helps set your mood as soon as you step inside. The food is good, in terms of both quality and quantity. You won't be disappointed with the steaks, pizzas or pasta preparations.
However, their service is a little laid back and they take their own sweet time to get your food. Expect a minimum of half an hour as the food preparation time. It's better to go to this place well informed about their service delay, instead of going there for a quick lunch and then regretting it, as was my case this time.

In any case, the quality of food was worth the wait. But it's better to inform the customers well in advance, about the expected serving time.

Taste : 5/5
That's all!
Love each and everything we had. 
And yes for a next time visit soon.
Also the ambiance is really nice and they have a pool too.

Quality of the food has deteriorated over the time. Quality of chicken was not so good. The starter was very good but egg 65 and butter chicken. Butter chicken in that was not soft and tender.  Before it used to be my favourite place but now it has lost the charm. I'll think twice going again there.
Very spicy n nice food.... Everything thing is awesome you'll love it....
Very nice hotel for maharashtrians....service food are good...veg and nonveg both are available...
Usually it used to be good. Today very bad, stomach upset. Got feverish too, sorry
Cheap decent food. Not very good but for the price you couldn't expect more

This restaurant serves authentic cuisine if Orissa. The food is good. The prices are low compared to similar restaurants. The staff are very warm. The service is quick. The vegetarian options are limited. It's a must visit restaurant if you want to try Oriya dishes.

Now a days the food quality has lowered. Before 1 yr I really savour the food over there. Now a days the taste of food is not awesome. If you don't want to take risk go for veg thali, you will always gonna like it. And the food is give you taste of Odisha specially.
Food superb. Good price. Need to improve on seating and ambience.

Love this food and restaurant.. Guys please go their once.. i must say u ll go again n over again .. Food was very tasty .. I must gave 5star to this restaurant but i was given 4star...1star was minus because it's area..
Amazing food. Relish the Odia food and have a good time here.

Visited today with my friend. With his influence.

The taste was good. 

But we have to wait for some time to get the food which we ordered.

Ordered masala dosa(Received token on pay at the token counter) and given for the delivery person.( There are multiple persons are standing in the delivery counter). Many people are already waiting for the ordered food. Delivery persons are taking tokens from the People and giving items. 

But what I noticed is there is no policy of "first come first serve". They are just giving the items who's ready to receive.

And I was also surprised that even they are not aware of whether they are giving the items to the right people or not.

And also I observed that some people are waiting at the table(Table serve).

Finally we received our items from one person at the delivery counter (I'm not sure he's is the one who received the token from us).

The taste was super. Enjoyed the food.

Gives a old time experience,  very good  masala dosa at reasonable rate. They have maintained the hotel just as it must have been decades back when they had started. Only morning and evening. But very busy road,  difficult to  find parking
Good quality food, good services. and reasonable rate.

Mangalore bajji and masala dosa are 2 hot saleable items, a decade back Vada was the most favourite among the Malleswaram people with hot tangy sambar, but these days the sambar is just ordinary and lacks the old charm the hotel commanded by the Bangaloreans - frequenting this hotel for the past 4 and half decades regularly

A old Bangalore charm with its own special vibe. Place is not modern or it's not a fine dining stuff. It's classic place and when you enter it you feel the authenticity.

Must try item
Masala Dosa
Badam burfi
good food. nice ambience
Food not good..and seat facility also very bad because of bedbucks.
Average restaurant with decent food..
Good place to hang out
Service is not at all good

The food here is just awesome. This certainly is one of the best restaurants for Mangaloren cuisine in the city. Even though the prices are slightly high they have quality food and service. They have valet parking and staff at the restaurant are very courteous. Toilet was nice and clean. Ambience could be improved.

"Chicken Varuval", my God heaven in the mouth...!!  Fantastic food, quiet ambience and great service. 
The pricing in on the expensive side. Maybe because of the rent and less table occupancy. That is understandable. 
I recommend it strongly and will definitely visit again myself. 
Cheers !!

I personally liked this place. Good sea food with options. Non Veggies will like this place. It is expensive but on par with MG road price (₹1500 for 3). This place is very close to MG road metro near Exit D on Church St. Valet Parking is available.
A quaint place that offers amazing seafood and delectable dishes. Must visit for seafood lovers. The service is great too and the price reasonable.
It's the greatest experience. Very good and hygienic. Full of taste.

Amazing food good ambiance. I visited alone and had the fish Thali as it gives the opportunity to try small bites of variety. If you are in a group check the display of fresh fish and sea food at entrance. Staff is good . Had a great meal.
Loved the food and the ambience. Service was good. Some more fish variety would have been nice.
The seafood is very good. I especially liked the prawn biriyani. Nice ambient place with friendly staff.
Best authentic Mangalorean food .... Super healthy rich of Omega-3 (as it fresh sea food ) and the taste is to die for !
Worth visiting with family , good taste n value for money

The spa is very well kept. Large rooms, quiet and clean. It's always relaxing as soon as you pass the door. 
There is a pleasant smell, the staff is friendly.

They offer a wide variety of services for women and men. Including waxing for men.
Amazing. Booked the the palms spa experience. Very professional and very clean. The balinese massage was super relieving of body pains.
Excellent awesome service very professional  service 5 star experience wish they give more advertisement must visit
Fantastic ambience, great staff! You can get some good deals on nearbuy and enjoy a couple of hours here.
Beautiful ambience and though they say 30 minutes, they actually go beyond the time mentioned and ensure a good service. They basically do their job very well. Must try

It is a decent place. They have fast food in the ground floor and service at the 1st floor. Toilet facility available in the First floor. There is need of a lift here for aged customers. Food is good and tasty.

Cheap, tasty food for all. I love how flexible their menu is. The north and south Indian menus are great and they keep improving the snack and appetizer sections. The newly added pasta might not be great, but the other food is pretty good if you're short on cash and you want a quick fix.

Upahara Darshini is a nice, quick and kinda healthy option for a snack or meal when you're in the area. This probably is the quickest and best bet for if you're at Cloudnine for a visit.

They have a pay and eat standing option that's pretty quick or there is also a service hall one level above the street.

The food is pretty decent and nominally priced too.

The worst service ever.. They don't even treat their customers properly when some issue raised.. I had very bad experience with this particular outlet. I ordered for jamoons in bulk and it wasn't even properly baked. When I raised this query the person who was on other side was too rude. He wasn't even ready to hear to my issue. Overall I hate this outlet n never ever want to visit here.

The food here is good. Nominal price, fine taste.
The ice cream scoops are really good and worth the price.
Blackcurrant's a must try, if you like the flavor.
Cheers

Timeless taste. They do a few dishes and they do them very well. But it comes at the cost of your diet. Lot of oil and butter but that's what gives the taste. Hard to find the place, it's a bit in road, but ask anyone and they will direct you properly. Don't expect a great ambience. The focus is only on the food. Prices are very reasonable. Must visit in Bangalore.

This place used to be amazing, but these days they have lost the quality of the food, one of the best place  that had the best rating for food but you can visit this once to feel it yourself. service is great and ambience is old school just the way it was when it started. must visit once atleast. i wouldn't visit this place again. this place is always crowded it's time they expanded into a bigger place with faster service.

Earlier when we were kids, we used to visit the place regularly. The taste of food was awesome. Now a days It is not as it used to be, quality is reduced drastically only people are rushing for the name sake which they would have heard from others. They have to get back the old taste, for which people were crazy.
Good to coin it as a historic place rather than a great restaurant. Food, restaurant & service all below average. Would recommend anyone to go & see from outside rather than eating there.

This iconic joint in Bangalore is easy to miss. They have the most amazing traditional Dosas. The filter coffee is almost perfect and the prices too seem to be from the time the restaurant was established. Really affordable, great food. Service can be a little tough and old school. Please check the timings before you go and it's usually pretty crowded.

I liked the place. Its busy and has decent management. Good food and servings. You can taste the authenticity of bengali cuisine at a reasonable price. Call in Reservation is must have  on busy days and holidays. After noon buffets and night time dine-in at night. 
I'll get back if time permits.

A great place for authentic Bengali cuisine. The makers of this place have put in great effort and it shows. The decor is really beautiful, the menu describes the local cuisines very well and service is right mix attention without interrupting your conversations.

5 star for food and service. Highly appreciate their attitude and hospitality. Visited this outlet on a weekday which is in my locality in saltlake

Overall its a gem in our locality in around cc1 Hope to visit soon again.
This is perhaps the best Bengali food place that we have in SaltLake. Each and every dish is excellent. Must visit if you are in town

The food is great in quality and really tasty. Anyone who loves Bengali food will come back to this place for more. The only drawback for me was that the meat served here is halal. Since I do not eat halal meat, I will think twice before coming here. However they have a selection of fish on the menu ,so there is an option there I guess.
Fish items are good.

Try not to visit in the evening because most of the food items won't be available. Food is fine nothing much to shout. Last but nit the least keep a check on your watch on Sunday afternoon visit you may not get seat if not booked prior.

Service has become very poor. I think the main problem being not enough waiters to attend all the tables.
 When we reached we took the last available table and it was not over crowded also. We ordered some starters, we could see the order reached the serving table but never reached our table for like 10 mins. Only after we asked for a couple of times the starters reached the table.

I have been to this place multiple times but never experienced such a service. They would have to figure out the problem if they have to retain customers.
Very good place, very tasty food, ambiance also good. Reasonable price..
Expensive but authentic food. No dedicated parking & expect long waiting during weekends. Slightly mismanaged in terms of service too.

Bad service. 75% of the items are not available and those which are available are served in low quantities irrespective of the unreasonable price. Been here two times, first time it was alright but second time, the quantity became even worse.

The food is quite authentic. Ambience is good enough. The staff are courteous and prompt. We stopped by for lunch. Though they had a buffet, we opted for a-la-carte. Our order was served quite late; had to wait almost over 45 minutes. But the staff were apologetic and gave us 2 complimentary dishes. Have to say though the wait was worth it, the mutton was cooked to perfection, the melt-in-mouth kind. The fish was also nicely done; a little heads up about the sweet taste of the gravy would be appreciated. Not everyone is familiar with bong cuisine. All in all it was a good experience.

Are you craving for some authentic Bengali food in a foreign land? Visit Oh! Calcutta. Amazon service, food quality at its best. Perfectly balanced ingredients, not much oily or spicy. If you go in a group, you will surely have a great time there. Ambience is also commendable.

One of the greatest place in Bengaluru to enjoy Bengali cuisine. Location wise perfect and valet parking make life easier when visiting this place.
Price wise on the higher side.

One of the few good bengali restaurants of Bangalore. It is a little pricey, but the food is delicious! They have lunch buffets, but I opted against it. Tried the mustard fish(sorse) which was amazing
Very tasty traditional Bengali food. Mouthwatering recipes. Calcutta Biriyani is awesome. Staffs are well dressed and well behaved, helpful. The ambience is very nice. Had a great experience.

Excellent excellent excellent food and service. I went in for the veg meal twice and left happy and full. My wife had the chilli chicken twice and loved it. It was the best she'd had on any continent. Especially nice of them to bring out more gravy to eat with the last of the rice. My favourite place we ate in Bangalore hands down.

They charge for small kids (below 8) a mini meal for Rs. 155/-. Its absolutely miserly and not worth it.... Other similar restaurants give kids meal free, if the parents dine there. We ordered fish fry (2 sear fish pieces as thin as paper) for Rs 355/-.... Ambience and facilities are excellent.. food is average...

Exceptional food. No comments.
People who love eating will love this place. Staff also very polite.
Only complaint is AC was not ON..else lovely experience
Good job guys
Taste needs to be improved. It will b good if parking facility is made available..
Love the veg meal here..every single visit has been pleasant..never disappointed. The steaming rice and greens dal, the thick cure, quick service and quick refill.love it.

-Value for money
-Good food 
-Bit costly
-Average quantity
-Great taste
-Hygiene
-Friendly
Good chettinad food near Koramangala.. A bit spicy for my taste but both quantity (sufficient for 2 people with one plate of gravy or dry item) and quality was good
Service was good. Nice attitude. All items were served hot. Fish finger and chicken lollipop were awesome.

The food was great and tasty. Make sure you get here before 1. Because the staff turn to headless chickens once the lunch rush begins. I was served by 4 different people at one sitting. Took them multiple attempts to get my order served correctly.
Liked coconut drink and jigarthanda. Appam is also good. Bit expensive though.

Really very good taste. When you enter inside it's all green and you find it extraordinary. Coming to the main point the Taste it's really good and super taste. Meals taste is also super. Must visit this . One will find it neat and clean with good environment.
The only minus point is the RATES. Rates are really high. But it's worth it.
The mutton biriyani here is heavenly!!! The place is well maintained and the prices are pocketed friendly. The service is fast and efficient.. definitely recommend this place to everyone
I have been coming here from last 20 years, taste have not got changed. Compare to all other Andhra restaurant in Bangalore. This is always better
Nice reliable Andhra style restaurant. Mouth watering delicacies. Peak hours should be avoided. Not so expensive. Parking is a bane.
Very good non veg hotel without bad masalas... Good taste and quality.
Better breakfast place for Tamil/Malayalis than many expensive restaurants around.Tasty and less crowded
Very cardial staffs. For a quick south indian breakfast very good place.

Semma Test and Treditional foods.
Low prise.
You will get dosa all the time in a day. It was good and ppl were nice too.
Decent place for a typical South Indian breakfast

Are you a ice cream lover ?
Like to go on late night drive for ice cream ?
Love to experience different taste of flavors ?

Then you must visit to Richie Rich ice cream joint and this place cant be missed in traffic junction. Always crowded almost everyday and in weekends this becomes too busy.
